titlestmt.titleproper: Levi Morris account of personal expenses 1835-1843
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Levi Morris account of personal expenses
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Levi Morris was an ironmaster, and founder of Levi Morris & Co. of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: Accounts of personal expenses at Philadelphia, 1842-1843. Entries include payments for tobacco, coffee, fruits and vegetables, cotton dry goods, and "promiscuous groceries." The volume also includes accounts for work done for Levi Morris, 1835-1836.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Levi Morris papers.
